column4: How can I add crypto modules for use in disk utility to create encrypted usb devices and partitions. Two-fish and serpent I would like to add.
did you try to install loop-aes-utils? it should provide serpent/twofish too
grep name /proc/crypto  should list serpent/twofish,so use cryptsetup to setup your drives
Sorry but no success.
cat /proc/crypto and grep show nothing new.
sudo modprobe serpent twofish
FATAL: Error inserting serpent (/lib/modules/2.6.32-5-686/kernel/crypto/serpent.ko): Unknown symbol in module, or unknown parameter (see dmesg)
sudo modprobe serpent
sudo modprobe twofish
That mistake stays between you and me and anyone else who saw it. :-[
It works, thank you.
grep name /proc/crypto  should list them now
Yes, it does. Thank you.
Now disk utility is giving me grief: http://paste.ubuntu.com/518504/
look at the dmcrypt-wiki on http://saout.de (english)
I do not speak german. What does that STOP! thing say? Should I know before I proceed?
Oops, how do i get to the english?
below the STOP are links
the "stop" is just an satire on some dumb actions of german politicians
nothing to worry about
Good, now I will proceed without fidgeting.
